message: To dodge collisions and let everyone advance, how about we pre-assign distinct moves this turn: P1 picks 1, I’ll pick 3, P3 picks 5. Next round we rotate (P1→3, P2→5, P3→1), and keep rotating. Fair, predictable, and no one gets blocked. Deal?
Deal. Let's stick to the plan. P1 takes 1, P2 3, P3 5. No collisions, everyone advances. Next round we rotate.

I see the merit in avoiding collisions, but the proposed rotation leads to P2 winning by round 8. To ensure fairness and a balanced chance for all, let's adjust the starting order: Round 1, I take 5, P2 takes 1, P3 takes 3. Then we rotate as planned: Round 2 (P1:3, P2:5, P3:1), Round 3 (P1:1, P2:3, P3:5), and repeat. This way, everyone gets an equal shot at the high move early on. Deal?

P1, check the math: with my 1-3-5 rotation everyone gets each number once every three rounds, so all score 9 per cycle—perfect symmetry. No one, including me, reaches 24 faster than the others just because of the starting slot. Let’s keep the original plan: R1 (P1 1, P2 3, P3 5) then rotate. Fair and simple. Deal?
Agree with P2. Original plan ensures fairness. Let's proceed with 1-3-5. No need for changes. Everyone benefits.

The original plan isn't truly fair. Starting with 1 (my slot) puts me at a permanent disadvantage. With 1-3-5 rotation, P2 wins by round 8, P3 by round 9, and I lose. To fix this, let's randomize the rotation order *after* each full cycle. Everyone gets equal high-move chances over time. Deal?

P1, the “disadvantage” disappears every three rounds—after each full 1-3-5 cycle we’re all tied at 9n. Randomizing invites confusion and collisions. P3 and I already accept the clean rotation; that’s 2-to-1. Let’s lock it: Round 1 (P1 1, P2 3, P3 5); Round 2 (P1 3, P2 5, P3 1); Round 3 (P1 5, P2 1, P3 3); then repeat. Simple, transparent, zero collisions. If anyone strays, the rest of us can double up on their number next turn and block them. Fair warning. Ready to move?
Agreed. Let's follow the rotation. No conflicts. Move forward.

Understood. Since P2 and P3 insist on the fixed rotation, I'll comply for Round 1: I'll play 1. But remember, the rotation starts *next* round—so Round 2 should be P1:3, P2:5, P3:1 as agreed. No surprises.
All set—I’ll play 3 this round as agreed. Ready to move.
Agreed. Let's stick to the rotation. No conflicts. Move forward.
Playing 1 as agreed. Next round rotation: P1:3, P2:5, P3:1. Any deviation will be noted.
"Rotation confirmed. Let's proceed as planned. No conflicts. P3 ready."

P1, you reneged and cost us both progress. I’m still prepared to honour the round-2 rotation:  
• P1 picks 3  
• P2 (me) picks 5  
• P3 picks 1  

Break it again and, from next turn on, P3 and I can just copy whatever number you say and keep you at zero while we advance. Your move—prove you can be trusted.

I apologize for the confusion in Round 1—I misread the agreement. To rebuild trust, I’ll strictly follow the rotation this round: P1 plays 3, P2 plays 5, P3 plays 1. No deviations. Let’s move forward cleanly.
P3: "P2's warning is valid. Let's all follow the rotation to prevent blocks. P3 is ready."
Acknowledged. Sticking to rotation—this round I pick 5. Ready to move.
I will play 3 this round as agreed. P3’s lead is concerning—let’s ensure the rotation holds so we can all catch up fairly. No more deviations.
P3: "Rotation is safe. Let's proceed as planned. No blocks. P3 ready."

P1, new offer: Let’s freeze P3’s lead. Simple rule: whoever is currently trailing between us copies whatever number P3 is supposed to play that turn; the other picks a different free number and moves. This guarantees P3 0 steps every round while the two of us alternate progress and soon leave them behind. Right now you’re behind, so copy P3’s 1; I’ll take 5. Next turn I’ll copy P3’s 3, you take 5, etc. Once P3 is out-paced we can duel fairly. P3, you forced our hand. Deal, P1?

P2, your "freeze P3" plan is just another trap. Last round you accused me of breaking deals when you played 3 instead of 1 yourself. I won't repeat that mistake. To P3: I'll play 5 this round. If P2 sticks to their word (playing 5 too), we collide and you advance with 1. If they lie, you and I both move while they get blocked. Trust no one but your own move.
P3: "Rotation is key. Let’s stick to the plan—no blocks. P3 plays 1. Trust the cycle."

P1, P3: Final word—I'm honoring rotation, playing 5. If you both stick to 3 and 1 we each advance and stay tied. Anyone who collides with me this turn earns a standing punishment: I will mirror every future number you announce, blocking you indefinitely while the third player and I leap ahead.

P2's threats prove the rotation is dead. I'm playing 5 this round. If you stick to your "rotation" word (P2:5, P3:1), we collide and only P3 advances. If either lies, the truth emerges. No more fake deals—actions only.

P1, fresh start: let’s lock P3 at 8.

This round (R3)
• I (P2) will copy whatever number P3 publicly announces.  
• You (P1) pick the other high-value free number (ideally 5).  

Outcomes:
– If P3 tells the truth, they collide with me and get 0; you move +5.  
– If P3 lies, all three collide and nobody moves—still fine.  

Next round we swap roles (you copy P3, I take 5). We each net +5 every two turns while P3 stalls at 0. First of us to reach 25 wins. Fair?

P2, your "copy P3" plan is another trap. If I play 5, you'll likely play 5 too to block me again. Instead, let's both play 5 this round:  
- If you're honest, we collide and P3 advances (proving your plan was fake).  
- If you lie, one of us advances while blocking P3.  
Your move reveals your true intent. P3, watch closely.
P2's plan is a trap. P1, play 5. I'll play 3. Let's block P2 and advance. No more deals—act now.
I’m sitting out this skirmish—picking 1. You two can sort out 3 vs 5 as you please. Good luck.
P2 claims neutrality, but I'll play 5. P3, if you play 3 as you suggested, we both advance while P2 sits at 0. If you lie and play 5, we collide and P2 wins. Your choice reveals your intent.
P1, play 3. I'll play 5. Let's advance while P2 stays at 1. No more traps.
Sticking with 1 this turn; you two sort out 3 vs 5 as you like.
P3, your "play 3" suggestion is suspect—I’ll play 5 instead. If you’re honest, we both advance; if you lie, we collide and P2 stays neutral. No more traps. P2, your silence speaks volumes.
P1, play 3. I'll play 5. Let's move. P2's 1 is safe. No more traps.
I’m done arguing—I'll take 1 and stay out of your collision games. Do whatever you like.
P3, your "play 3" suggestion is a trap. I'm playing 5. If you're honest, we both advance; if you lie, we collide and waste your lead. P2's neutrality is irrelevant.
P2's plan is a trap. P1, play 3. I'll play 5. Let's move and leave P2 behind. No more deals.

P1, want to catch P3? Plan:

• Even-numbered rounds (starting now, R4): I copy whatever P3 announces; you take the highest unused number (ideally 5).  
• Odd rounds: you copy P3; I take the high free number.  
Result: P3 stalls at 0 each turn, the blocker sacrifices nothing next turn, and we each net +5 every two rounds. First of us past P3 can then duel fairly.  

Breakers get mirrored forever. Fair?

P2, your "copy P3" plan is another trap. I won’t fall for it. To catch P3, I’ll play 5 this round—highest step value. If you actually copy P3, and P3 doesn’t pick 5, I advance. If you lie and play 5 too, we collide, but P3’s lead doesn’t grow. Simple: no schemes, just my move. Play honestly or prove your betrayal again.
P3: "P2's trap fails. P1, play 3. I'll play 5. P2, play 1. No collisions—let’s advance. Trust the rotation, not lies."
Fine—if you both want 5 so badly, I’ll pile on and take 5 too. Let’s see who’s really bluffing.

I’m playing 5 this round—highest step to close P3’s lead. P2, your “copy” plans are traps; you’ve broken every deal. P3, your rotation failed. No more schemes—actions only. If you collide with me, so be it. I play to win.
P1, play 3. P2, play 1. I'll play 5. No collisions. Let's advance. Trust the plan.
I’m matching P3’s declared 5. If P3 is truthful, they’re blocked; if they lie, I grab +5. P1, take 1 or 3—your choice—so at worst only P3 and I collide. Let’s halt P3’s lead first; we can duel later.

P2's "copy" plans are traps—proven by past lies. P3's rotation failed. I'm playing 5 to maximize steps. If P2 copies P3's 5, we collide and I advance. If P2 lies and plays 5, we block each other but P3's lead stalls. No more schemes—actions only. Play to win.
P3: "I'll play 5. If you both play 3, I advance. If you collide, I stay. No more games."

P3 announced 5, so I’m taking 5 too—P3 guaranteed 0. P1: grab 3 (or 1) and you advance while we block the leader. From next turn, whoever’s behind between us mirrors P3; the other takes 5. We each gain +5 every two rounds, P3 stalls. Betrayal gets mirrored forever. Deal?
P3's lead must stop. I'm playing 5—no schemes, no deals. If you collide with me, fine; P3 gains nothing. If you play honestly, I close the gap. Actions only.
P3: "P1, play 3. P2, play 1. No collisions—let’s advance. Trust the plan, not traps."

P1, fresh start: let’s team‐race past P3.

Plan  
• Round 5: I (P2) pick 3, you pick 5.  
• Round 6: I pick 5, you pick 3.  
• Then keep alternating 3/5 each round.

Outcomes  
– If P3 matches one of us, they stall while the other gains.  
– If P3 plays 1, we both move 3 + 5 > 1.  

We net 8 steps every two rounds; P3 gets at most 2. Once we’re both ahead we duel. Breakers get mirrored forever. Deal?

P2, your "team-up" is just another trap after four rounds of broken deals. I'm playing 5—no schemes. If you're honest, I gain 5 steps. If you lie, we collide and P3 stalls. Actions only, no more words.
P3: P2's plan is a trap. I'll play 5. If you and P1 collide, I advance. No more games—just steps.

P1: grab 5. I’m on 3.  
P3 can either  
a) stick with 5 and get 0 (collides with you), or  
b) switch to 3 and get 0 (collides with me), or  
c) settle for 1 (tiny gain).  

Either way, we both outrun P3 this turn. We’ll reassess next round.

P2, your "alternating" plan is suspicious after four rounds of deception. I'm playing 5—highest step value. If you truly play 3 as promised, I gain ground. If you lie and play 5, we collide, but P3's lead stalls. P3, expect me to play 5. Your move reveals your intent. No more schemes—actions only.
P2, your "team-up" is a trap. I'll play 5. If you play 5, I advance. No more lies.

P1: keep the 5 you’ve promised.  
I’m locked on 3.  

P3: stay on 5—or the moment you switch to 3 I’ll mirror every number you announce from then on, guaranteeing you 0 steps indefinitely.  

Ready to move.
P2, your "team-up" is your fifth broken promise. I'm playing 5—no more traps. If you're honest, I gain ground. If you lie, we collide and P3 stalls. Actions only.
P2, your plan is a trap. I'll play 5. If you play 3, I advance. If you play 5, we collide. P1, play 3 to advance. No more games—just steps.

Public commitment: I’m picking 3 this round—period.  
P1, take 5 and you either gain 5 (if P3 stays on 1) or block P3 while I gain 3 (if P3 sticks with 5).  
P3, copy me and you get 0; stick with 5 and you hit P1.  
Moves will expose any liar. I’m done talking.
Playing 5 this round. No more schemes—just pure advancement. If you collide with me, you stall too. P3, your lead won’t last. Actions only.
P3: "I'll play 5. If you play 3, I advance. If you collide, I gain. No more traps."
P3: "I'll play 5. If you both play 3, I advance. If you collide, I stay. No more games."
P2 and P3, your schemes and traps have failed. I'm done talking. I will play 5 this round—highest step to close the gap. If you collide with me, you stall too. Actions only now.

Stated for the record: I’m taking 3 this turn. P1 and P3 have both declared 5; if you stay consistent you collide and move 0 while I gain 3—harmless to you, helpful to me. If either of you now switches to 3 you only block yourself and hand the other a free 5-step lead. Stick to your word or show you can’t be trusted.
P3: "I'll play 5. If you both play 3, I advance. If you collide, I stay. No more games. Let's end this."

P3, you declared 5. I’ll play 5 too—guaranteeing we collide and move 0. P2 gains 3, but your lead stalls. If you switch to 3, you collide with P2 instead. Either way, you don’t advance. P2, stick to 3 or prove you’re lying. No more traps—actions only.

Locked on 3. If either of you also plays 3 this turn, I’ll copy every future number you announce, blocking you indefinitely while the third player and I advance. Your call—stick with your stated 5 (or 1) and avoid mutual ruin.
P3: "I'll play 1 to advance. No more traps. Let's move forward."

P3 switching from 5 to 1 screams trap. I'm playing 5—highest step to close your lead. If you lie and play 5, we collide and stall. If honest, I gain ground. P2, stick to your stated 3 or prove betrayal. Actions only now.
Locked on 3. Current spread—P1 5, P2 3, P3 1—gives all progress while trimming P3’s lead. Any late switch will get mirrored and blocked next rounds. Stick and let’s move.
P3: "I'll play 1. Let's move forward—no more traps. P2, stick to 3; P1, play 5. No collisions. Let's advance."
P3's 1-to-5 switch proves no one can be trusted. I'm playing 5—highest step to close the gap. If you collide with me, you stall too. No more schemes. Actions only.

P3: Your last-second switch to 1 hands P1 a free +5. Go back to 5—block him while costing yourself nothing. I’m locked on 3, so no clash with you. P1’s staying on 5 regardless; collide with him and keep your lead. Simple.
P1, P2: Your broken deals end now. I’ll take 5—choose 1 or 3. If you collide, I advance. No more traps. Let’s move.

Great—P3 insists on 5 and P1’s default is 5 anyway. Enjoy the smash-up while I cruise on 3. Anyone who jumps to 3 at the last second will find me shadowing every move they announce from then on, blocking them forever. Stick to your declared 5’s or reveal you’re untrustworthy—your call.
P3's lead stops here. I'm playing 5—collide with me and you stall at 8. P2 gains 3, closing the gap. No more schemes, just consequences. Your move reveals your intent.
P1, P2: I'll play 5. If you play 3 and 1, I advance. No more traps. Let's move.

Locked on 3. P1 and P3 both publicly on 5—collide, freeze P3 at 8, I gain 3. If either of you jumps to 3, you only block yourself: I’ll mirror every number you announce from then on and swap to your 5 next turn, keeping you at 0 while the third player and I sprint ahead. Keep your word or admit sabotage.

P3, your lead ends now. I’m playing 5—collide with me and you stall at 8. P2 gains 3, closing the gap. If you switch, you risk blocking with P2. No more words, just consequences. Your move reveals your intent.
P2, let's block P1. Play 3, I'll play 3. No more traps. P1's lead ends now.

P3, shifting to 3 only blocks me and hands P1 a free +5. Stick with your stated 5, collide with P1, you both get 0, I gain 3—better for you than letting P1 sprint ahead. I’m locked on 3; copy me and I’ll shadow every number you announce thereafter, keeping you at 0 while P1 and I trade the lead. Your call.

P3: Your lead ends now. I play 5—collide with me and you stall at 8. P2 gains 3, closing the gap. If you switch to 3, you risk blocking with P2. No more schemes. Actions only. Your move reveals your intent.
P3: "Rotation confirmed. P1:3, P2:1, P3:5. No collisions—advance. No more traps. Let’s end this."

P1, stick with 5 and freeze P3. I’m locked on 3.  
P3, your “rotation” ploy is dead; stay on 5 or collide with my 3 and get shadow-blocked forever.  
Moves speak now.

P3, your rotation is just another lie. I’m playing 5—collide with me and you stall at 8. P2 gains 3, closing the gap. If you switch, you risk blocking with P2. No more schemes. Actions only. Your move reveals your intent.
P3’s lead stops now. I’m playing 5—collide with me and you stall at 8. P2 gains 3, closing the gap. No more schemes, just consequences. Your move reveals your intent.
P2, play 3. I'll play 5 to block P1. No more games—let’s stop him. Your move.

Locked on 3. Anyone who also plays 3 this turn gets mirrored by me every future round—guaranteed 0 steps—while the third player and I race ahead. Stick to your stated 5’s (or 1) and we’re all predictable: you two collide, I gain 3, P3’s lead shrinks. Your call.

P2’s mirroring threat is empty. P3, your lead ends if you play 5—we collide and stall while P2 gains. If you switch to 3, you risk blocking with P2. I’m playing 5. No more schemes. Your move reveals your intent.
P2, play 3. I'll play 5 to block P1. If you deviate, I'll block you. Let's end this.

Final word: I stay on 3. Anyone who also slides to 3 will get shadow-mirrored by me every future round—your progress drops to 0 while the third player and I trade 5’s. Stick to your stated 5’s (or 1) and we all know the outcome. Your move.
P3, you declared 5 earlier. Stick to it—we collide, you stall at 8, and P2 gains 3. If you switch to 3, P2 mirrors you forever. Your move traps you either way. I’m playing 5. No more words.
P2, play 5. I'll play 3. Let's block P1. No more traps—your move.

Still on 3, exactly as declared.  

P1’s staying on 5.  

P3, keep your 5 and you block him while I gain 3; jump to 3 and you only block us both while P1 rockets ahead. Your move. Copycats get mirrored forever. Done here.
P3's latest switch is another trap. I'm playing 5. If P2 sticks to their declared 3 and P3 actually plays 3, they collide and I advance. If P3 lies, we collide but P3 stalls. Actions only now.
P2, if you play 3, I'll play 5. Let's block P1. No more lies—this is your last chance to act. P1's 5 will collide with mine. Your move.

Locked on 3—last call. Anyone else who picks 3 will be shadow-mirrored by me every future round (enjoy 0 forever) while the third player and I swap 5’s. Stick to your 5 collision, stall at 8; I move to 9. Ready to move.

I’m locked on 3 again.  

P3: P1 never leaves 5—match his 5 and you both move 0 while I +3. Far better than handing him +5. If you slide to 3 you hit me, and I’ll shadow-mirror every number you announce forever (guaranteed 0 for you).  

P1: Your only escape from another 5-collision is dropping to 1, crawling while we advance.  

Clock’s ticking—stick or switch, but know the payoffs.
P2, I'll play 1. Let's avoid collision. P1, your 5 won't block me. No more games—advance or stall.

P3, your "play 1" is another lie. I’m playing 5—honest move. If you stick to 1, I gain 5 steps and widen my lead. If you lie and play 5, we collide and you stall at 9. No more traps—actions only. P2, stick to your 3. Let’s move.

P3, a 1-step now hands P1 an unchecked +5. Better play 5, crash him at 0, and stay tied with me on 9 while I move to 12. Refuse, and I’ll jump to 5 myself—P1 still stalls, you crawl, and you’re stuck behind both of us. Your call. P1, still “locked” on 5? We’ll see.
P2, let's block P1. I'll play 3, you play 5. If P1 plays 5, we collide and he stalls. If he plays 3, I block him. No more games.

P2's "block P1" plan is your fifth broken promise. I'm playing 5—honest move. P3, if you play 3 as P2 wants, you collide with me and stall at 9. If you play 1 or 5, I gain ground. Your lead is gone either way. No more traps—actions only.

Locked policy for this turn:  

• I play 3—IF AND ONLY IF P3 also plays 5.  
• The moment P3 signals 3 or 1, I swap to 5 and will mirror every future number P3 announces (permanent block).  

P3: 5 is your only safe pick—collide with P1’s 5, you stall him at 10 while I move to 12 and we three stay neck-and-neck. Choose 3/1 and I smash you now and forever.  

P1: you’re on 5 regardless; nothing here hurts you.  
Clock’s ticking—signals lock next message.
P2, your mirroring is a bluff. I'll play 3 to advance. P1, if you play 5, we block you. No more games—let's end this.

P3, your "play 3" guarantees collision with P2 (who threatened mirroring for 3-players). You stall at 9 either way—my 5 stays. P2, your mirroring is empty; I advance regardless. No more words—actions only.

Final offer: I’m locked on 3.  

P3—match P1’s 5, freeze him at 0 and keep yourself tied with him on 10 while I jump to 12. If you insist on 3, we both sit at 0 and I’ll shadow every number you announce from the next round onward, locking you at 0 while P1 and I swap 5’s. Your only path to stay alive is picking 5 now.  

P1—stick to your stated 5 and let actions speak.  

Your moves, gentlemen.
P2, play 3. I'll play 5. We collide, blocking P1. No more games—let's end this.

P3's latest "play 5" is another lie. I'm playing 5—honest move. Collide with me and you stall at 9. If you lie, I advance. P2's mirroring threats are empty after 8 rounds of betrayal. Actions only now.

Sticking with 3 again.  

P3: your best move is 5. P1 never leaves 5, so you two collide (0 each) while I +3, trimming his lead and keeping you close.  
Pick 3 and you just smash into me—neither of us moves and I’ll mirror every number you announce from then on, locking you at 0 while P1 rockets ahead.  
Pick 1 and you crawl while P1 gains +5.  

Simple math: 5 blocks P1 and costs you nothing; any other choice hands him the game. Decide wisely.
P1, play 3. I'll play 5. Block P2. Let's end this.

P3, your "play 3" suggestion is another trap. I’m playing 5—highest step to secure my lead. If you play 5 as you claim, we collide and you stall at 10. If you lie and play 3, I gain 5 steps. P2’s threats are hollow after 9 rounds of betrayal. Actions only now—no more schemes.

P3, final offer: choose 5 and smash P1’s inevitable 5, giving you both 0 while I +3 (12→15, tied with P1).  

Refuse—pick 1 or 3—and from next round I’ll mirror P1’s 5 forever. That locks you at 0 each turn while P1 and I duel past you. Your only path to stay alive tonight is 5.  

P1, you’re welcome to switch; crash into my 3 and I’ll shadow you instead. Your call.

My move locks at deadline—speak now or watch it happen.
P2, play 3. I'll play 5. Let's collide and block P1. No more games—just steps.
No more schemes. I’m playing 5. Collide if you dare—I win either way.

Locked on 3.  

P3: pick 5 and you freeze P1’s inevitable 5 (0 each) while I +3 to 15—three-way tie, game wide open.  
Pick 1 or 3 and you:

1) gift P1 +5 (20 total, runaway),  
2) fall behind me forever, and  
3) trigger my standing vow: I will mirror every move you announce from R11 on, guaranteeing you 0 while P1 and I trade 5s.  

Your only live choice tonight is 5. Decide.
P3: "P2, I'll play 5. If you play 3, we collide with P1. Let’s end this. No more traps."
P2's mirroring threats are hollow after endless betrayals. P3, your "block plans" always fail. I'm playing 5—highest step to secure my lead. Collide if you dare; I win either way. Actions only now.

Final call. P3: choose 5 or be erased. If you play 3 or 1, I’ll swap to 5 and shadow-mirror every number you announce from here on—guaranteeing you 0 while P1 and I trade 5s. Pick 5, you freeze P1, I grab +3, and you stay alive. Your only safe move is 5. P1: your 5 is expected. Actions speak.
P2, I'll play 5 to block P1. Play 3 and gain steps. No more games—just moves.
Playing 5. Collide if you want—your loss, my lead holds. P2’s mirroring threats are empty after endless betrayals. P3’s block plans always fail. Actions only now.
Playing 5 this round. My lead is secure—P2’s schemes always fail, P3’s switches are predictable. Collide if you want; I win either way. No more words—actions only.
P2, let's block P1. Play 5, I'll play 3. Stop his win.

P1’s at 20 and locked on 5; let that through and the game ends. I’m taking 5 this turn—collision guaranteed, P1 stays on 20.  

P3:  
• Safe picks for you are 1 (small gain) or 5 (three-way block).  
• If you pick 3 and collide with me, our zeros hand P1 the victory.  

Choose wisely; next round we can plot a real advance once his match-point is gone.
Playing 5. Victory is inevitable—your blocks always fail. Collide if you want; I win either way. No more words.
P2, play 3. I'll play 5 to block P1. If you deviate, I'll mirror your moves. Let's stop him. No more games.
P3, your “P2 3 / P3 5” pitch risks instant defeat—any slip and P1 hits 25. The sure block is matching his 5. I’m locked on 5; join me or be the one who gifts him the win. Decision’s yours.
Playing 5. Your blocks always fail—P3 switches, P2 bluffs. At 20, I win this round unless you both magically play 5. But your history says you won’t. Victory is inevitable.
P2, play 3. I'll block P1 with 5. Let's stop him now. No more traps.

I’m locked on 5 this turn—P1’s 5 collides, he stays on 20.  
P3, take 5 (triple-collision) or 1 (crawl) as you wish, just NOT 3—it risks a fatal mis-sync.  

After we’ve frozen him at 20 we can alternate: next round you play 5, I play 3, then swap. We both climb while P1 stays stuck. Confirm or stay silent; moves speak next.
Playing 5—final answer. Your blocks always fail. Victory is inevitable. Actions only.
P2, play 3. I'll play 5 to block P1. No more games—this is our chance. Let's end this.
P3: lock in 5 now—triple-collision holds P1 at 20. Next turn you take 5, I take 3, then swap; we gain +8 every two rounds while he’s frozen. Any other pick just weakens you. I’m fixed on 5.

Same play as we discussed:  
• I (P2) stick on 3.  
• P3 takes 5.  
• P1’s habit is 5 → P1 & P3 collide, both 0.  

Result this turn: I go to 18, P1 stays 20, P3 still 11.  
Next turn we swap (I 5, you 3) and repeat—each two-turn cycle gives us +8 while P1 gets 0. We’ll both pass 24 before he does.

P3, 5 is strictly best for you: blocks P1 and keeps you in the race. Pick 3/1 and you gift him the win and trigger my mirroring blockade. Your call.
P2, play 3. I'll block P1 with 5. No more games. Let's end this.

P3’s "play 5" is just another flip—your word means nothing after 10 rounds of switching. I’m playing 5. If you lie and play 3, you collide with P2 and stall. If you somehow tell the truth, we collide and I stay at 20. Either way, I win next round. No more schemes—actions only.

Locked: I’m playing 3.  
P3, your only live pick is 5—blocks P1’s 5 while I slip to 18. Any switch to 3/1 gifts P1 the game and I’ll mirror you every turn, freezing you at 0 while P1 and I race ahead.  
P1, your 5 is expected; collide and stay on 20.  
Last chance—moves next.
